Title:
A new species of Tremella (Tremellales, Basidiomycota) from
southeastern China
Keywords:
Jelly fungi, phylogenetic analysis, taxonomy,
Tremellaceae
Abstract:
A new species Tremella zhejiangensis is described from
southeastern China based on phenotypic and molecular evidence. The
species is characterized by soft gelatinous, orange to dark orange,
cerebriform basidioma when fresh, thin-walled, globose to broad
ellipsoid basidia with a basal clamp connection, globose to subglobose
basidiospores with obvious apiculus measuring 15.019.0 × 1417.5 µm, and
growing on rotten wood of Liquidambar formosana. The phylogeny of
Tremella s. s. is constructed using methods of Maximum pasimony, Maximum
likelihood and Bayesian analyses based on the combined internal
transcribed spacer regions (ITS) and the large subunit (nLSU) dataset.
The results indicate that T. zhejiangensis forms a strongly supported
lineage from other species. The illustrated description of the new
species is provided and their related species are discussed.
